increased and improved as a result of the 
SMGL interventions. The interventions that 
contributed to higher numbers of C-sections 
in Uganda and Zambia included
  More CEmONC facilities.
  Improved transportation.
  Improved emergency referrals from 
lower to higher levels of care for 
women with complications. 
In Uganda’s SMGL-supported districts, the 
population-based C-section rate increased by 
23%, from 5.3% at baseline to 6.5% at endline.
